basics.name: Jie-Ren (Jarron) Shih
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary: As a 5 years experienced security expert, network consultant, infrastructure builder and developer, Jie-Ren is experienced in developing secure enterprise software and building high scalable H/A product, while experienced in all kind of virtual cloud platform, hypervisor and infrastructure from AWS, Azure, vmware, docker to serverless.

highlights: Design and move services from company datacenter to Cloud provider.

work.summary: Relocated to USA office. In network defense group, responsible for CI/CD, network traffic parsing and hosting an SaaS service.
highlights: Introduce CI/CD practice to the product, as the standard of the following project.
Enhance QoS to SaaS service, making different level customer sharing resource in cloud.
Parsing network traffic in packet level, work as data engineer in network analysis product.

work.summary: In Cloud and Data Center Security Product team, the most profitable products, responsible for SAP virus scan on Windows platform, including Anti-Malware, Javascript active script scan and Mail scan.
highlights: Integrate Anti-Malware solution and active script scan solution to prevent Cross Site Scripting Attack (XSS).
Develop virus scan interface for SAP on Windows platform to meet the market demand.

work.summary: In Cloud Storage Encryption Product Team, responsible for development boot device encryption feature and Linux software agents on cloud service platform.
highlights: Implement boot disk encryption feature to prevent boot data leakage on Windows and variant Linux distributions, including Ubunto, CentOS, RHEL, AmazonLinux and SUSE.
Implement software agent on major cloud service providers including Amazon EC2, Microsoft Azure and HP-Cloud

publications.name: [Patent] Root Volume Encryption Mechanism in Para-virtualized Virtual Machine
publications.summary: The present invention is generally related to provide data protection. More particularly, the present invention is directed to achieve root volume encryption in a para-virtualized virtual machine.

publications.name: Securing M2M with Post-quantum Public-key Cryptography
publications.publisher: Emerging and Selected Topics in Circuits and Systems / IEEE Journal
publications.summary: We present an ASIC implementation of two post-quantum public-key cryptosystems (PKCs): NTRU-Encrypt and TTS. It represents a first step toward securing machine-to-machine (M2M) systems using strong, hardware-assisted PKC. In contrast to the conventional wisdom that PKC is too expensive for M2M sensors, it actually can lower the total cost of ownership because of cost savings in provision, deployment, operation, maintenance, and general management.

publications.name: MIFARE Classic: Practical Attacks and Defenses
publications.publisher: Chinese Cryptology and Information Security Association
publications.summary: We report our experience attacking a real MIFARE Classic system. Specifically, we have implemented a brute-force search using NVIDIA graphics cards to verify the claims in the literature. To our best knowledge, this is the first report in the literature of a practical long-range attack. These attacks disarm all cryptographic protection of MIFARE Classic, making it extremely difficult to secure transactions. Lastly, we take up the challenge and present our ideas how to defend against most attacks using practical mechanisms that do not require any hardware changes.

publications.name: A practical experience with RFID security
publications.publisher: Mobile Data Management: Systems, Services and Middleware, 2009 / IEEE
publications.summary: We capture and analyze the communication between a legitimate reader and an EasyCard using GNURadio, an open-source software-defined radio running on PC. We will share our experiences with EasyCard security and provide some insights into RFID security in practice.
